Reviews.Title: “2* hotel with 4* prices”
Reviews.Author: mirasuri
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for two nights on a business trip. First of all, the customer service is appalling. People at the desk don't know what they're doing, many of them are nice and you can tell they're making an effort, but they are really not well trained and instructed. Customer service is something you would expect from a 4* hotel. The rooms are very average, trying to be fancy and cool with really tacky and average decor. My room had the heating on at full power and it was impossible to turn it down: I had to open the windows to avoid melting, which resulted in a horrible sore throat the next day. Brilliant. Not to mention the noises coming from the street which woke me up at 5am. The next night I ordered room service, a "4 formaggi" (4 cheeses) pizza and a chocolate pannacotta. The pizza was nothing short of awful: 4 cheeses were two, a very dry mozzarella and CREAM CHEESE ! ! ! ! ! cream cheese, on a pizza, in Italy! I was outraged. I spent €15 on it, and they even got the wrong kind of pizza the first time round, so I had to wait a total of 1hour and 15 minutes to have my (disappointing) dinner. The pannacotta was really bad as well, a weird texture to it and no flavour at all. Avoid it, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “we didnt stay there,yet we had lunch there,horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: lola2882
Reviews.Content: i cant find the'Le Bistrot Louge Cafe" in trip advisor so i decided to write a review here, first of all, the service is bad, there is one waiter for ten plus tablet..the poor girl was running up and down,she couldnt keep up.the food took two hs to come, i asked for steak medium and it can well done to not eatable. so i send it back (it took them 30mins for the new one to come). the meat was not one of the best quality. coca cola there costs 4 euros, and the mixed salad was drown with a tin corn...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for your vacation in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Irina Z
Reviews.Content: Review on behalf of my mum... Was her first time in Rome so she was looking at different areas but I insisted on Spanish steps and she says she didn't regret once!! Excellent choice location wise - beautiful atmosphere, close to everything, if you like to walk walking distance everywhere & if you want metro it is just 2 minutes from the hotel. if you want some Brand shopping Prada & Louis Vuitton are at the next street from the hotel. The hotel looks nice & outfitting of the the halls & rooms are antique and beautiful. One of the few hotels that i found that offers king bed for a single occupancy. She didn't want a single bed. Her room had silk on walls & nice furniture, pleasant to be in. The toilet had a shower & nice size. Wifi is free in the whole hotel however the room had a poor signal. Guess this depends on the floor is how far your room is.... Breakfast was fairly ok. Hotel has also a restaurant that is a popular spot& always busy. Staff was helpful & friendly. At the end she made friends with people working there & says she will definitely come back & recommends us & her friends to stay there too!! Mum had absolutely fantastic time in Rome ! And that would not be so without a beautiful hotel !

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: gagarz
Reviews.Content: Encountered a lot of problems right from the beginning, when arrived to the place to find out that they offer no free parking (as opposed to what was advertised), and unless you want to drive far away to try your luck in finding an empty slot at a public parking area, you have to pay 56 Euro per day for parking. The elevator is perhaps the smallest and the narrowest in the world! Just like the shower cabin is, having even no soap holder. If you are unlucky to drop the soap while taking shower, then... well, no way to take it back unless you stop taking shower and get out of the cabin! The bathroom has no (and I mean NO) place to put your necessities like toothbrush, shaver, etc... During early morning breakfast hour the staff may open the door to the street and starting bringing merchandise without even caring to apologize for discomfort and the cold they bring in to hotel guests having breakfast at that time. And if you decide to ask them to please close the door, you would only earn their dislike. In short, a very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant of the hotel is the WORST experience and disgusting food!!”
Reviews.Author: May Z
Reviews.Content: This review goes to the restaurant of the hotel. It's a shame that they have such a place open in a prime location as they definitely set a bad example to the rest. This place needs to shut down permanently! Service was extremely slow, waitresses were rude and completely unfriendly! It took more than half an hour to get the food which was by far the worst thing I have ever layed eyes on and tasted. Pizza was tasteless and hard, mushrooms on it were soggy! A simple mixed green salad was not edible. Then came the pasta, simple pomodoro pasta that was a complete embarrassment to any Italian. Off course when I asked for cheese for the pasta that never came! Wine was a total disgrace. They need to shut this place down!!!!!!! Horrible, horrible, horrible beyond explanation.

Reviews.Title: “noisy and poor quality”
Reviews.Author: Eliz60
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune to stay in this hotel for one night (three nights booked) our room was on the roof, the mattress was a piece of foam, no mattress cover, on a slatted base, the decor was very tasteless, brown wallpaper on the walls and ceiling, all opening at the seams, the windows were covered with one piece of brown material, the windows were old brown wooden frames and it was very noisy all night. We had dinner in the restaurant, garlic bread fine, pasta too a dente actually chewable and a bottle of house wine it was ok because we were late arriving but it was by far the worst meal we had. My tip, stay in the Majestic. Brilliant and well worth the extra

Reviews.Title: “Renovated and Perfect locations”
Reviews.Author: Alexandros D
Reviews.Content: Great location just a few steps from the piazza spagna. Very polite and helpful staff. The rooms spacious and nicely decorated with only one minus the old windows from where you can hear everything from the streets. Nice café bar in front of the hotel and a lot of restaurant around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: Ytlaram
Reviews.Content: We travel very frequently to Rome and it was our first time at this hotel and we really liked it. Not sure what the regular price of the hotel usually is, but we booked a rate of around US$120 per night. Here are our views of the hotel: 1) Recently renovated, not the greatest taste, but clean and new. 2) Amazing location, it has a very cool bar in the ground floor, and you can go anywhere walking (Via del Corso, Spanish Steps, Via Condotti, etc.) 3) Free Internet!!!- wow wow wow!! 4) Noisy Noisy - Just take some earplugs and you solve the problem 5) Decent breakfast - not all hotels offer free breakfast, it is not amazing, but it saves you a few euros and you can go to lunch to a good place I would definitely go back to this hotel. Rome is usually expensive and this is a very good compromise price-quality.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant service was diabolical!!”
Reviews.Author: robbie1962
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself decided to eat here on our second evening during a 3 day trip to Rome and although I can't comment on the establihment as a hotel / residential basis, I can say, as pretty hardy travellers, we had one of the worst experiences service-wise any where in the world !! The writing was on the wall really as it took two frantic waitresses 15 minutes to even acknowledge that we would possibly like a menu / drink, ( it wasn't actually very busy either !), but we stuck with it as the setting of narrow cobbled streets etc was lovely and we weren't in any major hurry. I'm going to try to cut a very long episode of events short, as what happened in the next hour and a half (!) was comical up to the point I actually got to see the manager to complain. It was plainly obvious ( and quite amusing ) that the two waitresses were totally incapable of fetching a few bland plates of over priced pasta / rissotto / pizzas to customers tables. A couple, who sat next to us, waited an hour for their 'meals' to be served and when they asked where their food was, they were told that they ( the waitresses ) had forgotten about them !!! and they had to wait a further 15 minutes ! During part of this waiting game, we also had to endure two male colleagues, ( what I could only guess were 'management' as they were doing alot of watching of the incompetent waitresses, without offering to help ! ), change a propane gas cylinder in a patio heater for about 10 minutes, les than 2-3 feet from where my wife was sitting, without offering any 'excuse me madams'....unbelievable ignorance!! Anyway....eventually, nearly TWO hours later, without being offered a dessert menu / another drink etc in all this time, we asked for the bill. The waitress came back and started to ask US what we had eaten / drank !! At which point I asked to see the manager, which was met with her throwing a bit of a tantrum and saying "I knew you were going to complain!!" She then told me I would have to go and find the manager as he was very busy! I then demanded to see the manager as we weren't prepared to settle the bill in full. In short one of the 'managers' came out about 5 mins later and we were virtually told that it was too bad, as they were having building work done and it wasn't a "fast food complex" !! No offer of any reduction or apology by him or anyone else, and we were eventually told to pay in full or he would call the police!! In summing up, this has got to be the WORST service I have ever received at a restaurant and would not recommend anyone to eat here, unless you want what we received... a poor expensive plate of 'food' with disgraceful disregard for customer service and extreme rudeness to boot! it ruined what should have been a pleasant evening for both of us! Apologies fro the long winded rant, but really needed to get this off my chest!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but over prices”
Reviews.Author: yellow-banana1115
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a fantastic location. It is minutes to the spanish steps and the Metro. It was located on a narrow street that is one of many lined with restaurants and little boutiques and designer shops. The streets surrounding the hotel were buzzing in the evenings which was great for eating and drinking but very noisy when you were trying to sleep in your room! The windows are old fashioned and although look very nice, not double glazed and keep no noise out whatsoever! The bathroom was of a very low standard. The decor was very basic and shabby, no shower and the tub drain did not work. The staff at reception were pleasant but did not go out of their way for you. They missed my wake up call which caused me to be late for a tour. They were not very concerned. Breakfast, was ok but again staff not very pleasant. It was not a four and I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, noise, noise!”
Reviews.Author: 5019wanderer
Reviews.Content: I never thought that I would be staying awake at 2:30 am because of a loud crowd outside of my room out on the street. This has been going on for the last two nights. Maybe that is the way it is here in Rome, everyone Complaint to the front desk but no use. We will cut our stay a day short and check out tomorrow. Do not be fooled by 4 star rating. It is barely a step above Motel 6. The name "Royal Palace Hotel" is totally misleading. I have to say though we left our safe unlocked on our first day and everything was untouched.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: Claire S
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a fantastic location. It is 2 minutes to the spanish steps and a narrow street that is one of many lined with restaurants and little boutiques and designer shops. It was a easy walk to trevi fountain, piazza navona and other attractions. We also easily walked to the vatican and trastevere from here. The streets surrounding the hotel were buzzing in the evenings which was great for eating and drinking but very noisy when you were trying to sleep in your room! The windows are old fashioned and although look very nice, not double glazed and keep no noise out whatsoever! We had a suite with two beds, split almost into two rooms and we had to move to the other bedroom (the smaller of the two) as it was further from the street to be able to sleep! The room was nice but the finish was not to a high standard and it was quite dark. We were however upgraded to a suite as it was our honeymoon which was a nice gesture. The bathroom was of a very low standard. The decor was very basic and shabby. The staff at reception were friendly but at breakfast, we always had to search for someone to ask for a cup of coffee. The food at breakfast was not of a great standard. Again, it was quite basic. We do not feel this hotel is a 4* . It would definitely be more accurate to grade it at 3*. We had a lovely time in Rome and you could not knock the location but we were a little disappointed with everything else as our expectations were a bit higher.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: axel16
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights there. Hotel is new - our room was large same for bathroom. Deco is modern. Good soundproofing - you won't hear your neighbors however bad soundproofing as far as outside traffic & voices on the street. Our room was not on the pedestrian part of via Carrozze so it was noisy as everywhere in Rome as streets are very narrow. This hotel should change their window and that would bring my rating to a four stars. There were also constructions next to our building and we asked management to change rooms - they were very accommodating and concerned so that is a plus for them. The staff working at the concierge/reception desk were very nice, welcoming and helpful. Breakfast was fine however the room is tiny to you have to cramp up with other guests if you don't want to wait for your own table.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no frills.”
Reviews.Author: Aksudntpron
Reviews.Content: Location was great and it was clean but this really is a no frills hotel. It was done to save money bit I enjoy the hotel get away experience. The elevator is small and old and the ac is average at best. The bathrooms are old and the showers felt like they were going to gall apart at any minute. There was a complimentary breakfast and the people were friendly. I would rate it a 3 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: claudje
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance from spanish steps en trevi! Also within easy walking distande of all the other major attractions such as pantheon. Good restaurant just around the corner with nice cocktails en good pasta dishes. Staff was very friendly, breakfast was great, with good cappuncino, fresh fruit, eggs in all variety etc etc. Don't let the taxidriver fool you from the strain station (termini) in paying 28 euro, it is really only about 2 km away, so if you want to safe money, take the 'metro' just two stops away!

Reviews.Title: “A really Excellent hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: liorv3
Reviews.Content: The best hotel that i ever stayed in Rome ! Good new looking rooms , comfort room . Very nice breakfast - with a nice choose of food , but they need to add a choose of juices . Excellent service - 24 hours service , 24 hours Check-In (no so obviously) , very patient and helpful . Best location (!!) - less than a minute frim the spanish steps and from the best shopping areas . There's a free comuter and print stand in the hotel and this is very nice ! disadvantages : -We had a 3 rooms and one of the rooms had a very dark design . -In one of the rooms the shower didn't worked so well . -The windows in the hotel are so old ! -The double room was small . For conclusion - this is the best hotel that i ever stayes in Rome !!

Reviews.Title: “Not Palatial nor Luxurious, rather dark and pedestrian”
Reviews.Author: SuTengKai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in May. The good thing is location, just tens of meters from the Spanish Steps and lots of good local restaurants nearby. And perhaps I can add two beautiful ladies at reception. But otherwise this hotel was a disappointment: - poor service - shabby rooms - dark, both literally and in color scheme - expensive - they scrambed the details of our reservation and rather than helping sort out the problem blamed us I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very clean”
Reviews.Author: jandktrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and found the staff and the hotel really very nice. The bathroom was all in marble and had all the ammenities. Safe and refrigerator in room. Internet was also in the room but was really not very good. There was a supermarket just down the street and I bought water, fruit and popcorn. The hotel had free ice available as well as a bar and the breakfast buffet was really quite a feast. Scrambled eggs, meat, all sorts of breads, cereals, sliced cheeses and meats, pastries, yogurts, juice and coffees. The staff was very accomadating in arranging tours and shuttle services. The #52 bus to take you into center city was just up the street for 1 euro. They offered a discount for the Hop on & off tour bus that takes you to all the monuments. I took a tour bus to Tuscany on the second day and was picked up and delivered right at the hotel. I would stay at the Claridge again, it is well worth the money for all that you get. It is also located in a really nice part of Rome near the Borgese Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “An hotel of character and quality”
Reviews.Author: oldtriathlete
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel, very close to the Spanish Steps, Via Condotti and some of the best restaurants and wine bars in Rome. This is not your "Plasticised Hilton" this is a real old style hotel, with furnishings and decoration to match. Old style grandeur with real character. Rooms were of a fair size, exceptionally clean, beds and towels changed daily. Brilliant staff and excellent breakfast. If you are looking for a modern hotel, with all the amenities, then the Carriage is not for you, but if you want character coupled with a great location and staff that care, then give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable two nights at Carriage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very run-down. The air-conditioning in our room wasn't working quite well. We needed a fan in the room. It was so hooooottttttt. We spent very uncomfortable two night. If we didn't have children with us, we would have left the hotel right away. We stayed there in late August 2003, the hotel needs a SERIOUS renovation.
